chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
items.plainText: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

items.text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
items.plainText: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

items.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
items.plainText: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

items.text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
items.plainText: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

items.text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
items.plainText: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

items.text: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
items.plainText: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

items.text: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
items.plainText: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

items.text: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
items.plainText: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

items.text: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
items.plainText: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

items.text: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
items.plainText: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

items.text: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
items.plainText: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

items.text: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
items.plainText: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

items.text: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
items.plainText: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

items.text: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
items.plainText: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

items.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
items.plainText: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

items.text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
items.plainText: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

items.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
items.plainText: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

items.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
items.plainText: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

items.text: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
items.plainText: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

items.text: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
items.plainText: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

items.text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
items.plainText: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

items.text: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
items.plainText: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

items.text: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
items.plainText: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

items.text: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
items.plainText: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

items.text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
items.plainText: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

items.text: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
items.plainText: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

items.text: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
items.plainText: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
